snippet: Many in the Afghan government believed that American officials misled them into thinking that the prisoner swap would not be done unless it was connected to a broader peace effort.
abstract: Heads of House and Senate Intelligence Committees criticize Obama administration's trade of Sgt Bowe Bergdahl for five members of Taliban without requiring larger agreement from Taliban to renounce terrorism and begin reconciliation with Afghan government; Afghan government also regrets loss of leverage in peace talks.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Matthew Rosenberg from Kabul, Afghanistan. Brian Knowlton contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Many in the Afghan government believed that American officials misled them into thinking that the prisoner swap would not be done unless it was connected to a broader peace effort.

headline.main: Critics of P.O.W. Swap Question the Absence of a Wider Agreement
headline.print_headline: Critics of P.O.W. Swap Question the Absence o f a Wider Agreement
